jobs.descriptionHtml:

At voize, we are revolutionizing the care industry with AI: Care workers simply speak their documentation into their smartphone, and our AI automatically generates the correct entries. This saves each care professional an average of 39 minutes per day, improves documentation quality, and makes their workday significantly more efficient and enjoyable.

voize is Y Combinator-funded, already used in over 1000 care facilities, and has grown 100% in the last 90 days. Our customers save over 3.5 million hours annually - time that is spent on people instead of paperwork.

But this is just the beginning. With our proprietary voize AI, we are not only transforming the healthcare industry but also have the potential to create value across multiple industries—from healthcare to inspections.

As a dynamic team, we combine cutting-edge technology with social impact.

💡 Your Mission: Own the First Contact and Grow the Sales Pipeline!

As an Enterprise Sales Manager at voize, you will build and also lead our Enterprise Sales team from the ground up since you get to set up the function, recruit top talent, and then drive growth with Tier-1 accounts. You will stay hands-on as you close planned deals also shape our enterprise motion under strong discipline. You'll also lead a great team of AEs and predict well, ensuring high growth and superb sales results.

🚀 Your Daily Business – No two days are alike

  • Lead & coach a high-performing Enterprise AE team with 1:1s, pipeline reviews, and deal strategy

  • Own the number by driving ARR growth, boosting win rates, and shaping quarterly plans with RevOps

  • Build the function with scalable sales processes, disciplined forecasting, and opportunity hygiene (e.g. MEDDICC)

  • Hire & grow top talent, accelerating ramp with strong onboarding, playbooks, and certifications

  • Close big deals by multi-threading execs, navigating procurement, and partnering across Marketing, Sales Enablement, SDR, and CS

🤝 Your Skillset – What you bring to the table

  • Enterprise Sales Expertise: 7–10+ years in B2B SaaS, driving $10M+ ARR and closing complex, multi-stakeholder deals.

  • Team & Process Builder: Skilled at setting up high-performing teams and scalable sales processes from scratch.

  • Coaching & Talent Development: Strong AE coaching, career growth, and hiring capabilities with a high-performance bar.

  • Sales Methodology & Execution: Fluent in MEDDICC, forecasting, pipeline management, and navigating complex deal cycles.

  • Executive & Regional Savvy: Confident with C-level stakeholders, experienced in the DACH market

  • You trust the data - analyzing metrics, spotting trends, and turning insights into action.

  • You take ownership - taking charge, delivering impact, and motivating others to rise with you.

  • You work better together - aligning teams, sharing insights, and turning complexity into clarity.

  • We are a fast-growing startup, you will tackle challenges, grow quickly, and make a real impact, giving healthcare professionals more time for real patient care

  • We foster an open, collaborative culture with regular team events, whether you work from our Berlin office or remotely from Germany

  • Become a co-creator of our success with stock options

  • Generous perks: 30 vacation days plus your birthday off, Germany Transport Ticket, Urban Sports Club, regular company off-sites, and access to learning platforms such as Blinkist and Audible

We look forward to your application and can’t wait to meet you – no matter who you are or what background you have!

jobs.title: Product Manager - US
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🎤 Why voize? Because we’re more than just a job!

At voize, we’re building AI that gives frontline professionals their time back. Care staff and other frontline workers simply speak their notes, and our AI turns them into structured documentation — saving up to 39 minutes per person per day and improving quality. We’re Y Combinator–backed, used by 1,000+ facilities, and growing fast. Join a team that blends cutting‑edge technology with real‑world impact.

💡 Your Mission - Build what truly matters

As Product Manager - US you will lead the build & the launch of our Senior Care product and scale a US‑ready product experience long term. You’ll validate product‑market fit with key operators, drive the first US pilots, integrate with priority EHR partners, and translate real nurse workflows into repeatable product value that sets the foundation for sustainable growth.

🚀 Your Daily Business - turning insights into impact

  • Lead discovery with US nursing leaders and caregivers, develop a deep understanding of user need & pain points and develop structured discovery & documentation processes, following PM best practices.

  • Define clear product requirements and product success metrics; optimise for outcomes and iterate quickly

  • Plan and execute MVP pilots with key operators; synthesise insights into a focused roadmap

  • Drive technical integrations with priority EHR partners and related systems; manage integration trade‑offs

  • Partner with our GTM team to support on pricing and positioning and align on long term product strategy

  • Ensure privacy, security, and compliance with legal and security partners

  • Report progress and learnings to leadership; propose go/no‑go and scale‑up recommendations

  • Lay groundwork to seed a US product team post‑PMF.

🤝 Your Skillset - What you bring to the table

  • Extensive experience in Product Management shipping SaaS products, ideally in healthcare.

  • Proven track in leading entire product domains or groups, owning the long term product strategy.

  • Experience launching products into the US market and conducting discovery & user research.

  • You work discovery & hypothesis-led and have strong testing & product analytics skills.

  • Excellent stakeholder management across execs, GTM, partners, and customers

  • Language: Fluent English (C1/C2). German a plus

  • Willingness to spend significant time on‑site with US customers; travel as needed.

🎯 Our Success Mindset - How we work at voize

  • You own the outcome: You have a bias to action, resilience, and rapid learning in ambiguous environments

  • You put the user first: Deep empathy for caregivers and obsession with user outcomes over output

  • You are data-driven and detail-oriented: You made decisions based on data, but know how to make pragmatic trade-offs

  • You value open communication and constructive feedback: You contribute to a positive team culture and challenge the status quo.

🌱 Growing together — what you can expect at voize

  • Become a co‑creator of our success with stock options

  • Hybrid work with a Berlin office or across Germany, or US‑based with regular customer on‑sites

  • Generous perks in Germany: 30 vacation days plus your birthday off, Germany Ticket, Urban Sports Club, and access to learning platforms like Blinkist and Audible

  • Regular team events and on‑sites, an open culture, and real ownership from day one

✨ Ready to talk? Apply now! 🚀

We're looking for product people with passion, desire to learn, and entrepreneurial mindset. You're encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn't precisely match the job description.

Your skills and experience will stand out & set you apart - especially if your career has taken some extraordinary twists and turns. Voize welcomes people from all different backgrounds, including age, citizenship, ethnic and racial origins, gender identities, individuals with disabilities, marital status, religions and ideologies, and sexual orientations to apply.

We're excited to hear from you!

  • Passion for training and coaching: Experience in delivering training sessions or mentoring others, ideally in a healthcare or caregiving context.

  • Technical affinity: Comfort with technology and learning new software quickly, with the ability to teach others to use it effectively.

  • Fluent in German (C2) with good knowledge of English.

  • Willingness to travel 2-3 times per week to onboard our customers (based in Berlin, Munich, Cologne, or Frankfurt preferred).

As a dynamic team, we combine cutting-edge technology with social impact.

As Customer Support Manager (m/w/d), you’re the first point of contact for our users – and the voice of voize when it matters most. You’ll make sure that our customers get the most out of voize by providing fast, empathetic, and effective support. You’ll solve problems, streamline processes, and help shape the future of a product that truly makes a difference.

  • Be the first point of contact for our users, offering fast and solution-oriented support across platforms and systems

  • Support new customers during onboarding and help them integrate voize seamlessly into their daily workflows

  • Create and maintain clear, user-friendly help materials like FAQs, guides and documentation

  • Act as the voize of our users by identifying recurring issues and sharing feedback that drives product improvements and optimizations
